channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: VToonify: Controllable High-Resolution Portrait Video Style Transfer
item.description: Although a series of successful portrait image toonification models built upon the powerful StyleGAN have been proposed, these image-oriented methods have obvious limitations when applied to videos, such as the fixed frame size, the requirement of face alignment, missing non-facial details and temporal inconsistency.

item.title: Towards Robust Blind Face Restoration with Codebook Lookup Transformer
item.description: In this paper, we demonstrate that a learned discrete codebook prior in a small proxy space largely reduces the uncertainty and ambiguity of restoration mapping by casting blind face restoration as a code prediction task, while providing rich visual atoms for generating high-quality faces.

item.title: Pseudo Numerical Methods for Diffusion Models on Manifolds
item.description: Under such a perspective, we propose pseudo numerical methods for diffusion models (PNDMs).

item.title: Designing BERT for Convolutional Networks: Sparse and Hierarchical Masked Modeling
item.description: This is the first use of sparse convolution for 2D masked modeling.

item.title: DAMO-YOLO : A Report on Real-Time Object Detection Design
item.description: In this report, we present a fast and accurate object detection method dubbed DAMO-YOLO, which achieves higher performance than the state-of-the-art YOLO series.

item.title: mindcv
item.description: A toolbox of vision models and algorithms based on MindSpore

item.title: Utilizing supervised models to infer consensus labels and their quality from data with multiple annotators
item.description: Many algorithms also rely solely on annotator statistics, ignoring the features of the examples from which the annotations derive.

item.title: Tracr: Compiled Transformers as a Laboratory for Interpretability
item.description: Interpretability research aims to build tools for understanding machine learning (ML) models.

item.title: BEAT: A Large-Scale Semantic and Emotional Multi-Modal Dataset for Conversational Gestures Synthesis
item.description: Achieving realistic, vivid, and human-like synthesized conversational gestures conditioned on multi-modal data is still an unsolved problem due to the lack of available datasets, models and standard evaluation metrics.

item.title: ImMesh: An Immediate LiDAR Localization and Meshing Framework
item.description: This voxel-wise meshing operation is delicately designed for the purpose of efficiency; it first performs a dimension reduction by projecting 3D points to a 2D local plane contained in the voxel, and then executes the meshing operation with pull, commit and push steps for incremental reconstruction of triangle facets.

item.title: DeepMatcher: A Deep Transformer-based Network for Robust and Accurate Local Feature Matching
item.description: In this work, we propose DeepMatcher, a deep Transformer-based network built upon our investigation of local feature matching in detector-free methods.

item.title: EDICT: Exact Diffusion Inversion via Coupled Transformations
item.description: EDICT enables mathematically exact inversion of real and model-generated images by maintaining two coupled noise vectors which are used to invert each other in an alternating fashion.

item.title: Instant Neural Graphics Primitives with a Multiresolution Hash Encoding
item.description: Neural graphics primitives, parameterized by fully connected neural networks, can be costly to train and evaluate.

item.title: Muse: Text-To-Image Generation via Masked Generative Transformers
item.description: Compared to pixel-space diffusion models, such as Imagen and DALL-E 2, Muse is significantly more efficient due to the use of discrete tokens and requiring fewer sampling iterations; compared to autoregressive models, such as Parti, Muse is more efficient due to the use of parallel decoding.

item.title: Ankh: Optimized Protein Language Model Unlocks General-Purpose Modelling
item.description: As opposed to scaling-up protein language models (PLMs), we seek improving performance via protein-specific optimization.

item.title: RTMDet: An Empirical Study of Designing Real-Time Object Detectors
item.description: In this paper, we aim to design an efficient real-time object detector that exceeds the YOLO series and is easily extensible for many object recognition tasks such as instance segmentation and rotated object detection.

item.title: SmoothNet: A Plug-and-Play Network for Refining Human Poses in Videos
item.description: With a simple yet effective motion-aware fully-connected network, SmoothNet improves the temporal smoothness of existing pose estimators significantly and enhances the estimation accuracy of those challenging frames as a side-effect.

item.title: Triton: An Intermediate Language and Compiler for Tiled Neural Network Computations
item.description: The validation and deployment of novel research ideas in the field of Deep Learning is often limited by the availability of efficient compute kernels for certain basic primitives.

item.title: Free-Form Image Inpainting with Gated Convolution
item.description: We present a generative image inpainting system to complete images with free-form mask and guidance.

item.title: High Fidelity Neural Audio Compression
item.description: We introduce a state-of-the-art real-time, high-fidelity, audio codec leveraging neural networks.
